Anti-U.S. and anti-war struggle called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. and anti-war struggle called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The headquarters of the People's Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces in a statement on June 13 reportedly called for staging a dynamic struggle for peace against the U.S. and war.
 The statement said that the U.S. is getting frantic in its ceaseless military exercises and arms build-up to exterminate all the 70 million Koreans after killing the two schoolgirls, calling on the people to replace the anti-U.S. candlelights by the peace torches against the U.S. and war to smash its moves to unleash a war on the Korean Peninsula.    
 Noting that as long as the U.S. forces stay in South Korea, their crimes will not stop and there can be no peace and stability in this land, the statement strongly demanded the U.S. forces, a group of criminals and a time bomb for a war, quit South Korea at once.

Chinese residents help Korean farmers
articles.content:
Chinese residents help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Chinese residents in South Hwanghae Province visited the Yongyang Cooperative Farm in Haeju city on June 18 to help farmers in pulling rice seedlings and rice transplantation.
 During a break, they sang songs and talked with farmers.    
 They handed aid materials to the farm.
